text: hi this is Tate Taylor I am director and
producer of get on up okay what we have
here is the filming depicting when James
Brown recorded his album live at the
Apollo chadwick boseman of course is
playing James Brown this is Fred Melamed
playing Syd Nathan who is concerned that
James's vocals are not going to be heard
with all the brass behind him of course
we all know that James Brown's vocals
were always heard that does bring up an
internal son Ellis who plays Bobby Byrd
but the vocals on this did bring up a
challenge we had we used all James
Brown's voice in songs for for every
performance and we chose to use live
performances this one in particular is
an early early recording and the quality
was the poorest of all the recordings we
used that and out of sight because they
weren't separated and the quality of
recording simply was not good so we had
to really work hard on sweetening this
the best we could and and but
unfortunately we could not separate
James's voice so we made the creative
decision to put it even though it wasn't
recorded perfectly front and center and
just celebrate James and fill in and
sweeten the brass behind him
and we shot this in Natchez Mississippi
believe it or not we converted a 1930s
High School Auditorium into the Apollo
and and as you see there Chadwick is
just killing it and there's Biola Davis
and some wonderful women locals of
Natchez Mississippi this is also the
scene where viola Davis's character
Susie Brown who's been estranged from
her son James comes to the Apollo to see
him perform that look musicians back
there are really playing so we sweetened
the whole thing just made it a
celebration and I think it works great
Oh
